content.question: Which of the following would best support the claim that the timing of the molting process in certain species is influenced by seasonal changes in the daylight period?

choices.label: More species that molt seasonally do so when the daylight period is the longest, than when the daylight period is the shortest.
More species that molt seasonally do so when the daylight period is the shortest, than when the daylight period is the longest.
More species that molt seasonally are found in the arctic, where the daylight period varies, than near the equator where the daylight period is relatively constant.
More species that molt seasonally are found near the equator, where the daylight period is relatively constant, than in the arctic, where the daylight period varies.

content.answer: More species that molt seasonally are found in the arctic, where the daylight period varies, than near the equator where the daylight period is relatively constant.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
